f6_assessments.q0: It is not at all clear that CPI data on 47 African countries is the key requirement for microlending or Defi apps to be successful. The proposal asked for nearly the entire challenge budget and is basically identical to the a proposal by the same proposer in the Scale up Cardano's Defi Ecosystem challenge. Could we not get this data from the world bank (https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/FP.CPI.TOTL.ZG), why should it cost $85,000.
f6_assessments.q1: Very little data has been provided on how the CPI data be provided. What resolution? How is the data verified. What are the data sources? Examples from Europe don't necessarily hold for Africa. How is the data paid for going forward? For Instance oracles pools on ERGO have a mechanism to pay providers for each data point. The proposer has also not provided information showing that hey have the technical capability to implement this.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no timeline for delivery or detail on the actual data to be provided for progress to be assessed against. What counts as success? How will provision of this data aid the challenge goal of micro lending in Africa?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is lacking information about some parts of it, and it's not possible to assess its impact.The problem statement is unclear, and the detailed plan does not include relevant information to increase its understanding. Regarding challenge alignment, it mentions African countries, but does not go into much details about why they would be chosen and how the proposal could benefit them. The proposal should include information about some KPIs and measurable goals to check the Challenge alignment, and to quantify the impact and added value to the Cardano ecosystem. Besides that, information about the proposal's scalability should be indicated and explain how it would be sustainable in the long term. Score: 1
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer mentions his experience as a finance industry manager for 20 years, but it doesn't give more information about it's background and ways to check it. The proposal should include a plan for implementation detailing how each of the mentioned phases would be implemented, what would be the smaller steps and how they would be executed. Also, it should state if the proposer is going to execute the proposal himself or if there will be a team working together with him. The budget is broken down into 4 steps, but they are not well explained and should include more information. Also, the roadmap should include some dates and deadlines for partial deliveries. All this information should be added into the proposal to make it possible to evaluate its feasibility. Score: 1
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the auditability, since the proposer didn't include any information about the roadmap, milestones, deadlines, metrics and KPIs, it is not possible to assess the auditability of the proposal itself. Also, the budget should be broken down in order to make it possible for the community to check the project's expenditures and to really understand why the proposer is asking for $85k. This information should be included in the proposal if the proposer wants to re-submit it in a future fund. Score: 1

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is for sure implementable but lacks clarity in the methods employed to address the challenge and at its current state lacks any proper details to support its implementation.
The proposal did not highlight the sources of data to which the Oracle will draw from and how it will be implemented on the blockchain.
Considering the requested amount of $85000 which is 94% of the allocated funds, the proposal have no clear breakdown on how the requested funds will be used, which would have helped to justify the request.
With the above points , i can neither agree nor disagree that this proposal addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Considering that the implementation of an Oracle is a technically challenging process, the proposal failed show any implementation roadmaps,Timelines and potential challenges for such a technical process like working on an Oracle.
Stating "more than 20 years experience in finance industry as manager " does not clearly give any indication of experience or the Geo-location in which this was achieved, considering "20 years as Finance Manager in African Development bank in Nigeria" will easily give us a reference point of the experience provided.
With the above points, i can neither agree or disagree that this proposal can be implemented based on the skill presented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal lacks a clear representation of auditable milestones and timelines where not clearly written as abbreviations where used without a proper definition, this makes understanding the timeline difficult as "30PD" could mean anything.
The lack of a more detailed timelines and milestones clearly shows no way of auditing the Proposal.
